results.name: default/mysql-54dc48b99-7fdwr
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is unable to pull the Docker image "mysql:5.7" from the registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull mysql:5.7`.

results.name: default/wordpress-75698ffb4d-x9rb7
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-54dc48b99-7fdwr], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod events with `kubectl describe pod mysql-54dc48b99-7fdwr`. 3. Ensure containers are running and not in crash loop. 4. Verify readiness probe settings. 5. Check logs for errors.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-75698ffb4d-x9rb7], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-75698ffb4d-x9rb7`.
3. Look for readiness probe issues or errors.
4. Fix any configuration or resource issues.
5. Restart the pod if needed.
